intro: Buphthalmum pratense, commonly known as the meadow buphthalmum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive dark center, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped and hairy. Buphthalmum pratense is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with suitable conditions.
